feed.title: OpenBao Releases
feed.subtitle: Self-hosted software releases generated by selfh.st

entry.title: New release for OpenBao: v2.1.0
entry.content:
Note:

  • This release does not ship with the UI enabled. The UI will be available in the future. #129
  • OpenBao does not provide support for Vault Enterprise features. If there is an enterprise feature you would like to see added to the project, please open a feature request.
  • OpenBao is fully API compatible with Vault 1.14.9, and seal compatible with the plugins the project supports. Plugin support for OpenBao can be found here.

New Features:

  • Remove Mount Table Limits: Using transactional storage, we've split the auth and secret mount tables into separate storage entires, removing the requirement that the entire table fit into a single storage entry limited by max_entry_size. This allows potentially hundreds of thousands of mounts on a single scaled-up server. [GH-622]
  • Transactional Storage: Plugin developers can now take advantage of safe storage modification APIs when the underlying physical storage supports them. The physical.TransactionalBackend and logical.TransactionalStorage types allow developers to begin read-only and writable transactions, committing or rolling back the desired changes. [GH-292]
  • Transit: Support PKI CSR and certificate storage alongside key material. This allows callers to securely create keys and submit requests for certificates without the key material leaving Transit. Storage of the certificate on the key avoids the need for an additional K/V mount. Rotation of this certificate and its chain is also supported. [GH-536]
  • auth/oidc: Add a new callback_mode role option value device to use the oidc device flow instead of a callback, add a new poll_interval role option to control how often to poll for a response, and add a new callbackmode=device option to the oidc login method in the cli. [GH-319]
  • auth/oidc: Add new callback_mode=direct role option to cause the oidc callback to be direct to the server instead of the client, and add a callbackmode=direct option to the oidc login method in the cli. [GH-318]
  • physical/postgres: Reintroduce Postgres database for OpenBao storage, implementing paginated list support. This feature is currently in preview and breaking changes may occur. [GH-467]

Changelog

  • 93609bf0c73a18dd81ac8c7d21b95cbde1e4887c: Add changelog for v2.1.0 GA (#772) (@cipherboy)
  • d083548295ce14fe3df80270ad9f15da42206ed8: Bump go-kms-wrapping, openbao-template prior to release (#770) (@cipherboy)

(for additional changelog entries, check out the beta release)

entry.title: New release for OpenBao: v2.1.1
entry.content:
Changelog

entry.title: New release for OpenBao: v2.2.0
entry.content:
[!TIP] This is the first release with Web UI support!

New Features:

  • ACME TLS Listener Certificate Provisioning: Automatically fetch TLS certificates for OpenBao Server's TCP listeners via an Automatic Certificate Management Environment (ACME - RFC 8555) capable certificate authority (CA). This allows OpenBao to be self-hosted, using a CA contained within the instance to sign the instance's own certificates. [GH-857]
  • PKCS#11 Auto-Unseal: Add support for automatic unsealing of OpenBao using a PKCS#11-enabled Hardware Security Module (HSM) or Key Management System (KMS). [GH-889]
  • Scanning: introduce the ability to recursively list (scan) within plugins, adding a separate scan ACL capability, operation type, HTTP verb (SCAN with GET fallback via ?scan=true), API, and CLI support. This also adds support to the KVv1 and KVv2 engines. [GH-763]
  • Transit: Add support for key derivation mechansims (derives a new key from a base key).
  • This path uses the named base key and derivation algorithm specific parameters to derive a new named key.
  • Currently, only the ECDH key agreement algorithm is supported: the base key is one's own ECC private key and the "peer_public_key" is the pem-encoded other party's ECC public key.The computed shared secret is the resulting derived key. [GH-811]
  • UI: Reintroduction of the WebUI. [GH-940]
  • raft: Added support for nodes to join the Raft cluster as non-voters. [GH-741]

What's Changed over Beta

 * 8c6ec0b9eeed30ceabaa2c3770f32fa9ba63a296: Add API and CLI commands to promote/demote nodes in the Raft cluster (#996) (#1072) (@JanMa) * cf7800c1dca701ab5443f08b36b19dc6100542f2: Backport: Bump actions/cache to v4, use pinning (#1064) (#1078) (@JanMa) * 7e7146b5acbf14e8e6a43e24c1e781031290238f: Backport: Bump github.com/hashicorp/cap from 0.8.0 to 0.9.0 (#1058) (#1077) (@JanMa) * a2bf51c891680240888f7363322ac5b2d080bb23: Release 2.2.0 (#1082) (@JanMa) * 158c6b258b50249823a366115fa93b03bac11d44: cleanup leftover DR Token options (#1018) (#1074) (@JanMa) * 72fed382445ef9356f3ffc9b38b8329d64c84898: fix(ui): repairs missing checkmarks, in checkboxes, due to invalid usage of sass-svg-uri (#1042) (#1076) (@JanMa) * 04a8a01b377aaf887fd34838621a2d79035a62d2: identity: return metadata when listing entity-aliases (#1013) (#1073) (@JanMa)

Release notes: https://openbao.org/docs/release-notes/2-2-0/#220 Full Changelog: https://github.com/openbao/openbao/compare/v2.1.0...v2.2.0

entry.title: New release for OpenBao: v2.2.1
entry.content:
[!TIP] This release has WebUI support!

BUG FIXES

  • cli: Return a quoted string URL when -output-curl-string flag is passed in [GH-1038]
  • openbao: update modules and checksums to address vulnerabilities [GH-1126]
  • secrets/pki: Remove null value for subproblems encoding, fixing compatibility with certain ACME clients like certbot. [GH-1236]

What's Changed over v2.2.0

 * fc60d38efdba5f9ba8388eb6e347044de11f4930: Backport core deps (#1252) (@cipherboy) * 630d250252ccc771ca968f72d1e8b8fee6fa9069: Do not encode empty subproblems in ACME (backport of #1236 by @cipherboy) (#1248) (backported by @cipherboy) * 3ea230458f55f7bfeca577a49013cbcbe42a1142: Fix name of org-level maintainers team (backport of #1237 by @cipherboy) (#1249) (backported by @cipherboy) * db2b1944ca088d73dbcbe314b2a08be5f7b85809: Fix vault/diagnose test failure (backport of #1221 by @cipherboy and @driif) (#1247) (backported by @cipherboy) * af6a785b3a156b1c343d7c1ab391ee685c052331: Fix vulns (backport of #1126 by @suprjinx) (#1245) (backported by @cipherboy) * 91733be3109e5a5000b750939e5748433c78cfcf: Release v2.2.1 (#1255) (@cipherboy) * f5cc129b176c93391891b2e9050f901b05ff874a: Return quoted string when -output-curl-string flag is passed #1038 (backport of #1238 by @sudhanvaghebbale) (#1250) (backported by @cipherboy) * 17b7feff3896fb4dd21c2845f019d1a504371052: build: update Go version and dependencies (backport of #1209 by @driif) (#1246) (backported by @cipherboy)

Release notes: https://openbao.org/docs/release-notes/2-2-0/#221 Full Changelog: https://github.com/openbao/openbao/compare/v2.2.0...v2.2.1

entry.title: New release for OpenBao: v2.2.2
entry.content:
SECURITY:

  • sdk/framework: prevent information disclosure on invalid request. HCSEC-2025-09 / CVE-2025-4166. [GH-1323] @cipherboy

BUG FIXES:

  • ui: Fix description of Organizational Unit (OU) field in PKI. [GH-1333] @cipherboy

What's Changed

* Prevent information disclosure on invalid request (#1323) by @JanMa in https://github.com/openbao/openbao/pull/1374 * Bump ubi9-minimal from 9.5 to 9.6 (#1329) by @JanMa in https://github.com/openbao/openbao/pull/1376 * Fix description of OU field in UI (#1333) by @JanMa in https://github.com/openbao/openbao/pull/1377 * Renew `goodcertbadroot.pem` (#1351) by @JanMa in https://github.com/openbao/openbao/pull/1378 * Bump to Go 1.24.3 (#1324) by @JanMa in https://github.com/openbao/openbao/pull/1375 * Bump github.com/ebitengine/purego to v0.8.4 (#1373) by @JanMa in https://github.com/openbao/openbao/pull/1379 * Release 2.2.2 by @JanMa in https://github.com/openbao/openbao/pull/1380

Full Changelog: https://github.com/openbao/openbao/compare/v2.2.1...v2.2.2
